title: Question About C9T
body: If Cloud 9 Tempest were to make it into LCS and Cloud 9 were still in the LCS, would C9T have to change their name and company owner due to the rule that a company can't have more than 1 team?

replies.body:
We had a similar situation happen when Curse (now Team Liquid) and Curse Academy (now Gravity) qualified for the LCS. If C9T and C9 both qualify for the LCS, the C9 organization will sell one of the teams. The new owner would be in charge of the team's name/branding. 

For more information, check out the [2015 LCS ruleset](https://riot-web-static.s3.amazonaws.com/lolesports/Rule%20Sets/2015%20Summer%20LCS%20Rule%20Set%20Version%202_03.pdf).

What would happen in Team Dignitas EU gets into the EU LCS? Will they have to be sold as well, or is one team per LCS league okay?

Is what I would have asked before I just looked at the ruleset.
I just hope C9T gets in and C9 loses in the promo tourney. That would be funny.
